Lumeris Trade Princess

The ships appear to be a merchant fleet, and their crew are ill-prepared to fend off your boarding parties. Early resistance is dealt with harshly. The traders are soon broken and cowed.
Your troops spend several weeks stripping the vessels of their cargo and resources, until the only question left is what you will do with their people.
Their leader--a Lumeris trade princess named Aurelia--comes before you to beg for mercy.
Her golden eyes are rimmed in black, the dark pigment now streaking down across her blue-skinned cheeks.
Her voice is clear and defiant, and she speaks your language fluently. "You have taken everything from us. Cruel and without mercy," she spits the words out, before her voice softens.
Her angry lips--a delectable shade of peach--suddenly glide into a wide, suggestive smile. "Please. You are great and we are very weak. We see that now." Her voice softens even more, as if a lover's coo, "Please show me...and my people, mercy. Do not leave us to die out here among the stars."

Take the princess and her crew as slaves.
Princess Aurelia and her people can still serve a purpose. You order your troops to take only the young and healthy.
The princess would be grateful that her people were allowed to live.

Princess Begs

Upon hearing of your decision, Aurelia comes before you once more: this time to beg for her own life.
Both the simmering anger and the veiled sweetness are gone; now there is only fear and desperation in her swollen, red eyes.
Bowing down low, she chooses her words carefully. "Please. I know that I can do no more for my people. I have led them as best as I can." She looks up--directly at you--and pleads, "But I can still be useful, if you allow me the chance."
Aurelia pauses, as if searching your language for just the right words. "As an advisor, perhaps? I know deals and I know dust. Allow me to council you. Please, let your interests become my own."
Lowering her eyes--her words gravely humble--she promises to earn her life in service to you.

The princess will be grateful you spared her life.

Aurelia Adapts

Your culture is dark and your society is brutal; you never expected a seemingly delicate flower like Aurelia to survive.
And yet she does so much more: Aurelia flourishes. It takes the former princess a few months to find her footing, but soon her influence can be felt at the heart of nearly every major plot or plan. Though she serves your closest advisors--and they universally do their best to diminish her contributions--you can feel her dark brilliance nearly everywhere.
The order to slaughter disobedient miners on a harsh moon--a swift escalation even your top generals would not have so boldly suggested--quells a potentially inconvenient rebellion before it can begin.
The genocide of an entire, indigent population in the slums of your capital--millions upon millions of souls--immediately frees up resources for another war front.
Aurelia is growing and changing; become darker and more cruel by the day. This intrigues you.

Aurelia will be very interested in this opportunity.

Aurelia desires the great power this will give her.

Allow Aurelia to continue to serve your great empire. She is but one among many who will enforce your will upon the cosmos.

Aurelia is Dead

Aurelia continues to serve your great empire for many years to come.
Her ideas are often revoluntionary. Her plots usually take her enemies by surprise. But it is her gruesome efficiency that becomes a thing of legend.
One by one your closest advisors are stripped from you. This one by intrigue; that one by assassination. Everyone knows that it is Aurelia's hand that brings their downfall, but there is never any proof.
She suffers retaliation, of course; there are many attempts on her life. But it always end the same: her beautiful, Lumeris body coated in the red sheen of her attacker's blood.
Her fortunes rise and fall across the years, but she always continues her struggle. And in that struggle, she becomes something truly more: a beautiful monster.
And that is ultimately her downfall. She drifts so far from that young woman you met, all that time ago. She is too weak to accept the perfection that she has become.
Her slaves find her dead one morning, apparently by her own hand.

You take Aurelia as your personal servant and for years she fulfills her role.
In the early days you could often see the defiance in her eyes; the hatred that she bore for you and your cruelty. But over time it seemed to fade. Her voice became sweeter and her nature was more compliant. She seemed to know her place.
But it was all a lie.
You wake from sleep one night to find her on top of you, stolen blade in hand. She very nearly plunges it into your neck before you grasp her wrists and turn it back on her. The moment she senses that she has lost the struggle, her eyes go dark and she suddenly adds her force to your own; the wicked blade drives deep into her chest. Warm, red blood gushes out, soaking everything.
"Finally, I am free."

Lumeris Trade Princess

Your ships spend several weeks helping the strangers. Their mission seems to be a blend of exploration, harvest, trade and diplomacy. It appears their vessels were attacked by frontier pirates.
While many races make up their crew, they are led by a Lumeris trade princess named Aurelia.
"I greet you warmly, and thank you for coming to our rescue," she begins. Her voice is clear and vibrant, and she speaks your language fluently.
Golden eyes dart quickly across you. Rimmed in black and shimmering with a dust-infused pigment, they bespeak her great intelligence.
Her lips slide into a warm and easy smile. "Our ships," she starts, "they will not make the journey back to our homeworld. You have been so kind already. May we ask for more generosity?"

Aurelia Departs

It was not easy. You spent an enormous amount of time, energy and resources cobbling together a fleet for Aurelia and her people. But it was worth it.
Your reward came in all the days that you were able to spend with the alluring Lumeris female. Afternoons and dinners devoted to going over all the little details became mere pretext to spend time talking and bonding. A blossoming friendship grew into something more; and by the end it seemed as if she might not go at all.
And yet this day was always coming: the day you would have to say farewell to Aurelia.
You stand at a hangar door. It seems far too plain a setting for such an monumental event.
The starkness is all the more heart-wrenching when Aurelia finally appears. Her lithe but curvacious body is draped in rich, red silks, and her golden eyes are rimmed as dark as the day you first met her.
Your eyes meet, and you both know that it is time to say goodbye.

Trade Princess Returns

It seems that the worries were unfounded. While the new fleet is well-armed--sporting a number of very impressive gunships--its primary purpose is to facilitate trade.
They are led by a familiar face: the Lumeris trade princess Aurelia.
She greets you at the same hangar door where you once said farewell, all those years ago. She wears the same red gown. Her golden eyes are rimmed as black as ever, and yet they seem changed; poignant somehow.
"I shared the story of your great generosity with my father and with my family. My people were very grateful for all that you did for us...for me," she tells you. "If you wish it, we have returned to offer you a trade alliance. It will make both of our nations very wealthy, and..." Her voice trails off for a moment as she looks away.
When she looks back, her peach lips quiver only slightly; the only hint of emotion on her still-youthful face. "Well, if you wish it, my family has suggested that I remain here." She smiles. "That I stay here as...a representative." Her smile broadens at the corners of her mouth as she looks away, "for trade."

Assimilate the Traders

It is a long and emotional journey for Aurelia and her people.
Before you arrived, they had very nearly accepted their end. If you had been of a more hostile bent, they would have died still; or worse.
And now, huddled aboard your transport ships--taking only what they can carry--these refugees are about to start an entirely new life upon your homeworld.
The gravity of their situation dawns on you during one of your many talks with the trade princess.
They will survive, of that you have no doubt. But to live and thrive? They will need to find some way of fitting in to your society. It may not be as easy for them as you wish it to be.
You look deep into Aurelia's dark-rimmed eyes during one of your final meetings with her. You realize that no matter how much you try to help them, you cannot save them from the hardship they will face.

Red Houses

You made it easy for Aurelia and her people. Perhaps a bit too easy.
The Lumeris trade princess has grown wealthy over the past few years. Naturally shrewd and gifted with both language and the social graces, her people have spread throughout the trade and service sectors. They now hold many of the most desirable jobs in your economy, and it doesn't seem like they are content to stop there.
Most recently, Aurelia has begun to open her now infamous Red Houses. Dens of pleasure, these exotic and exclusive clubs see traffic by even the highest officials in your government. While the former trade princess and her developing cabal pay their taxes--generating a windfall of dust for your empire--there is now talk of blackmail, bribery, and other illicit scandals. Everything seems to lead back to her.

Allow Aurelia to continue with her plans. She has done well for her people, and she generates a tremendous amount of dust for your empire.

Exile Aurelia from your homeworld. It was a mistake to allow her to settle here, and she now has the wealth to remove herself from your worlds.

The Red House

You didn't make it easy for Aurelia and her people.
In the early days of their resettlement, the traders did their best to find honest jobs. They labored, gathered, and provided service work. Some of them found positions in your diplomatic corps, while the most skilled went to work in your research labs.
But poverty weighed heavy on Aurelia and her people. Isolated--and not entirely welcomed--by your native population, they turned to an easier life and sold a more base commodity: pleasure.
From the slums of your great capital, Aurelia now runs a wide-ranging operation. Blue-skinned urchins sell pleasure drugs on street corners. Lumeris dancers--barely clad and possessed of an exotic beauty--now dominate your culture's social clubs. Even other, minority races rally behind the trade princess; she has become a beacon for the "other" in your society.
The center of their collective--commonly called the Red House--is a large building in the heart of your slums. Countless vagrants, migrants and homeless people of all races gather there. While some of your advisors condemn it as a blight on your great city, there is an order to their community. Everyone at the Red House has a job and a purpose; everyone has a safe place to sleep at the Red House; and everyone eats.

Aurelia is Wed

Aurelia does well over the years. Her pleasure dens remain a mainstay of your empire's culture, and before too long they have spread throughout your colonies and into space itself. At last count she owned twelve great luxury liners, ferrying the richest and most influential individuals to and from your home system.
And her Red Houses have expanded their services as well. Originally they offered simple pleasure drugs and exotic dancers; but now almost any desire--from high-stakes gambling to the most deviant acts of passion--can be fulfilled in one of Aurelia's houses.
There was talk, for a time, that Aurelia might eventually set sail on one of her great ships; that she would travel back into the stars from which she came.
But then you hear of her wedding to one of the wealthiest ship-building magnates in your empire. It's nearly impossible to avoid the news. Aurelia has become a social darling in your culture, and her wedding is branded as the most luxurious event in a generation.

Cult of the Red Flower

Aurelia continues to nurture and grow her Red House in the slums. The building--originally a condemned warehouse--is gradually repaired. And as the years pass, the old structure becomes the center of a new and rising district. It starts with the nearby blocks, but it quickly spreads from there.
Violence disappears. There is an eerie calm in the streets. Those who live in the area can only describe it as a philosophy of thought; something that just clicks in the mind one day.
Aurelia's followers are everywhere. They are the same lost souls that followed her so many years ago, in the beginning. But now, instead of being poor and homeless and forgotten, they live in a plain sort of comfort. Decrepit houses and crumbling buildings have been rebuilt with the help of the entire community; now there is food and shelter for everyone.
Aurelia herself is rarely seen these days. As her territory grew, she became more and more reclusive. Some say her followers have constructed tunnels beneath the city, and that Aurelia now lives in a secret, undergound complex.
Others claim she is dead and some even whisper that she has become a divine being; a saint.
A cult springs up around Aurelia and a red flower--symbolic of a popular, plant-based pleasure drug that is widely sold on the streets of your capital--becomes her symbol.

The Red Queen

Aurelia uses her accumulated wealth, combined with extensive use of blackmail and her considerable political capital, to buy a massive fleet of ships. Most of them are older trade and military vessels, but one among them stands out: The Red Queen.
The largest and most advanced of your empire's privately-owned vessels, Aurelia somehow manages to acquire this ship. She immediately rebrands and retrofits it to her desires.
"For my protection," she says seductively, when confronted about the purchase.
Months later, Aurelia and her people disembark. The were ostensibly headed back to their system of origin, but you should have known better. Taking most of her people--as well as some of your own--Aurelia instead settles in and around the dense asteroid field of a nearby system, where she reportedly establishes a pirate's den. You send spies to investigate, and they tell you that she rules this new haven with a serpent's tongue.
Pleasure drugs and illicit goods--dark things of value--continue to flow freely into your empire, and you are powerless to stop it. Apparently Aurelia left her own network of spies and criminals behind when she left.
Though the pirate queen may be exiled, her presence is felt everywhere. Again and again, her ships launch surgical strikes on your trade and transport vessels; almost as if she were being fed information. Some of your closest advisors are soon revealed to be spies, long ago turned by the dark secrets she kept on them. And worst of all, your native people clamor for the seductive narcotics only she manages to smuggle in.
Aurelia has you beat.

The Red Queen

You want Aurelia and her people gone. You want the blight of the Red House removed from your capital.
Aurelia accepts your decision with an eerie grace. "As you wish," she promises, her smile saccharine sweet. "But please. Just a few more days to make our plans?"
It seems reasonable at the time, but it soon becomes clear that she never intended to leave.
Shortly before Aurelia is scheduled to depart with her closest advisors, they all suddenly go missing. When you send your troops into the slums to search for her, they find the Red House empty and abandoned. And no matter how high you set the bounty on her head, no one ever comes forward with her whereabouts.
It's as if Aurelia and her people simply disappeared. But the pleasure drugs never stop flowing. And other substances---darker, more dangerous things--soon join them on the streets.
And then come the scandals erupting across your empire. Stories of blackmail, bribery, addiction and adultery begin to dominate your empire's news networks. It feels inescapable and inevitable; it feels like everything is falling apart.
But perhaps the most bizarre thing of all is the newly-coined myth of the Red Queen. Your people say her name in reverant whispers; some among them even begin to pray to her, as if she were a god. The Red Queen, protector of the poor and the keeper of secrets. She who is said to despise tyranny; she who lurks in the darkest shadows.
Aurelia has become invisble; but her presence can be felt everywhere.

Summon Aurelia

You send word to Aurelia that you would like an audience.
She arrives in a dazzling show of red silk and dust-infused glamour.
Her golden eyes seem to brighten the moment they find you. "It has been too long. I am so pleased to be here with you once more." Her lips--sheening brightly with golden dust--spread wide and easy. "Please, tell me. What may Aurelia do for you?"
Everything feels intimate and close; as if your last conversation had been only yesterday.
And the years have been very generous to Aurelia. It's hard to find signs of age in her gloriously graceful Lumeris body; but you can feel it in her soul. She seems even more composed, and her confidence and grace has grown exponentially.
And perhaps most alarming is the deeply seductive quality to her every word and action. You can feel yourself being slowly drawn in by Aurelia's charm.

Aurelia Becomes Your Advisor

Everything becomes so much easier once Aurelia is involved. Deals that had been difficult to negotiate are quickly resolved. Your government's trade, industry and economy take off, far exceeding everyone's wildest projections. And even your goals and personal projects--some of them mere fantasies before Aurelia--now seem possible and within reach.
By keeping her as an advisor, you get to witness Aurelia's talents firsthand. Her tongue drips with honeyed words. Her charisma is overwhelming and addictive. But most of all, she is supremely smart and tactical in everything she does. She listens, she studies, and when she finally acts, it is always with extreme ease and grace.
This continues for several years, until one day Aurelia comes to you with an idea. You've always kept her well-rewarded for her work, but she has never before asked you for anything specific. And yet this request seems very important to her.

A Wedding

A few years pass, and Aurelia seems genuinely happy with her life on your homeworld. She contributes much to your empire, and forges deep connections among the elite.
It comes as a bit of a surprise, then, when she annouces her plans to wed a mogul from the private sector. The first you hear of it is in the invitation that arrives; her plot spelled out in embossed, golden lettering on a rich, cream stock.
The ceremony is a luxurious affair, blending Lumeris customs with the traditions of your own people. The guest list reads as a who's who of politics and power in your empire.
Aurelia has done well for herself through association with your government, and now it appears that she plans to move on.

Dinner With Aurelia

Delicious flowers overflow the center of a great table bedecked with edible delicacies. There is far too much here for just the two of you to eat, but your orders that morning were very clear. Everything. Everything she could possible want. Whatever taste; whatever smell; whatever texture she craved, it must be present.
This entire evening is orchestrated to communicate your attraction for Aurelia.
An attraction she clearly reciprocates. You can read it in her golden eyes. Normally tight and seductive, her pupils are now as wide and full as the twin moons of your night sky. Her body--draped in a thin and luxurious gown--draws your gaze again and again. You cannot stop looking at Aurelia, and she notices that.
She laughs. A lot. A dark and silvery thing, that sound of joy from her lips. From her expressive mouth. A slight quiver to her peach lips. Her tell, if ever Aurelia had one.

Aurelia Seduces You

One by one, Aurelia wins over each of your advisors with her seductive charm. Her words are intelligent, and her arguments are carefully prepared; but ultimately, Aurelia's success comes in the elegance of her delivery.
During one of your longer breaks, Aurelia approaches you in private. "Things are going well, it seems." She offers the words, but you can sense a deeper meaning. Her smile slowly widens, full of mystery and pleasure.
"I like it here," she murmurs, giving you a long gaze, golden eyes studying you deeply; intently. And then her playful smile returns again. "Would you be angry if I told you that this is really not very important to me at all?"
You ask her what she means, and she just laughs; the sound delicious to your ears. "What I really want," she starts, and then raising her arms wide, asks, "All of this?" You can't help but see the shape of her body as she spreads her hands up into the air; beneath her semi-sheer, golden robes, her form is firm and lithe and long, but full of gentle curves. And then she looks back down to you, bringing her arms around in a graceful sweep so that her palms are up; together; pointing at you.
"All of this, when all I want is you," she says finally, her face awash in a gentle glow; her sweet and honest eyes unguarded.
Accept
Accept Aurelia's love.
Accept Aurelia's confession of love. She is extremely lovely and her feelings are very sweet

Aurelia Becomes Your Lover

Aurelia responds with a simple, graceful kiss. Her lips--like honey--are sweet to the taste; and every taste leaves you hungering for more. Her mouth pressed against yours. Her body tight and close. The dust-laced smell of her skin in each ragged breath. You feel wanton; delerious; addicted.
And beyond that first tryst, Aurelia becomes a near-perfect lover. Her eyes and mind always seem to be upon you. It's as if she's studying you; learning and adapting; becoming a more perfect mate.
She is so addictive and charismatic. At some point you joke that she must be drugging you. Her response is an eerie laugh, sublimely divine and cacophonic all at once.
And yet you wouldn't care. Couldn't care, even if she was. You feel as if you are drowning in golden pleasure.
Love
Love Aurelia deeply and completely.
Love Aurelia deeply and completely. You struggle to govern your empire for she has become your world.

Aurelia's Invitation

Your relationship with Aurelia springs into full blossom. She is unlike any lover you've had before. She is sweet and addictive. Her nature is dark, but playful and inquisitive. And when it comes to intimacy, Aurelia is as wicked and unconventional as lovers come.
But more than that, you realize that Aurelia is opening herself up to you; her dark petals cautiously unfurling. There is so much depth that she keeps hidden away. Like a golden mirror, Aurelia shines back what others want to see; but as you grow closer to this exotic flower, you find a deep and golden well at her core.
She's gazing at you lovingly after your latest tryst, her golden eyes melting and dripping with emotion she doesn't try to hide.
"Let's go away," she murmurs lovingly. "From all of this. For just a little while."

Dying Romance

Over time, the intensity of your relationship with Aurelia seems to fade.
Everything was so intense and passionate in the beginning; her every glance left you titillated and excited.
But now it seems that all you ever talk about is work. Trade. Industry. The Empire.
You both find excuses to spend time apart. You see each other less and less, and when you are together, the time feels lonely and uninspired.
And deep down, you have this nagging suspicion that Aurelia's attention might have drifted elsewhere.

Flower of Bliss

From orbit, the moon looks small, but vibrant. There is a singular continent on the planet-facing side of the tidally-locked moon. The landmass overflows with dense green jungles; it is punctuated by twisting rivers and a cascade of great lakes. Aqua blue, coastal shallows line the edges of this paradise.
But while they look beautiful from orbit, the jungles are terrifying in person. The canopy of the trees and the thick bush before you are alive with the squawks, chirps, roars, rustles and the buzzings of countless living creatures. In the distance, you even spot some hungry thing moving beneath the sun-baked sand.
Naturally, Aurelia runs ahead of you as soon as you land, her fingers touching this leafy thing and then that flower. "Come on! We have to explore!" she calls out across the windswept beach.
The dangers of the moon are quickly forgotten against Aurelia's pleasure. She begins to strip down almost immediately, so that the ferns and the flowers can brush against her naked skin. It would be embarassing if you didn't already know her so well from your private interactions. As she rubs her face and nose into a massive, glorious bloom, her eyes purr with pleasure.
"This one," she murmurs, dripping her long, slender fingers into a silky-clear nectar, "...is full of bliss." She looks up at you seductively, her face flooded in euphoria. "Try this...with me?" she begs, her words a slur of pleasure.

The Bonding

The substance tastes sweet and otherworldly. From the moment it touches your tongue, your mind flies free. You spend days writhing in pleasure with Aurelia on the hot, sandy beaches. You wade into the warm waters together. You laugh and you giggle like children playing. Everything seems so happy and delerious. So lost. It's as if time just stops. You stop to think about that for what seems like...forever, and then you feel dizzy and then you realize that you're sitting beside a great, roaring fire with Aurelia.
The psychedelic high is wearing off now. Aurelia stares at you, her mind already clean and clear. How long has she been looking at you like that? How long will she continue to stare into your very soul, lost in a blissful peace.
"I love you," she says simply. It lacks all the gild and glimmer that normally adorns her words, but it is perfect this way. "I love you," she says again.
And then with a great big smile--a happy smile--she pulls something from an old, leather satchel that she brought with her to the moon. You've seen this bag before--in her private chambers--but she has never let you look inside it.
From the ancient leather, Aurelia pulls a dust-infused fern frond. In the dark of the night, it glows like a great torch, even brighter than the bonfire at your side. Sparkles of ancient gold drip like embers from its feathery leaves.
"This," she says, with a seductive smile, "is an ancient and rare thing. It comes from my homeworld. This plant is all but extinct now." She chuckles a bit, as she runs one finger across a brittle, glowing leaf. "A love fern. A dust fern. The essence of this thing has so much power." She pauses for a moment, as if lost in deep thought. "The power, even, to join two souls. Two bodies," she says, now looking directly at you. "If you do this with me, you will feel as I do. And I will always know your pleasures and your pains. For all the rest of our days, we will be as one."
